0.prompt:
You are an analyst, and you need to write a 300-word comparison of "Hulk" and "Superman". Please focus on strength. You need to single out the better of the two. Please be as short and concise as possible but prioritize quality. Below is a list of related arguments for or against, please use only the relevant ones. When you use an argument, please cite its number in square brackets right after the usage. Below the summary, list the argument numbers you used. If an argument is not relevant to "Hulk" or "Superman" at all, do not use it. The needed structure is: summary (100 words), bullet-point list of the most topical avenues of comparison (200 words or more), the best option (3 words only). Please avoid artificial balancing of arguments.

2. In the comics, any Superman outside of PC, isn't physically superior to Hulk.
3. He speaks worse than stupid Hulk does.
4. "Ang Lee's HULK was better than Donner's SUPERMAN."
5. Not only that, he's smart-not smarter than Dr. Bruce Banner, but definitely smarter than the Hulk.
6. Superman Returns was a worse film than the discarded attempt at the Hulk before the last Hulk - it should be discarded and forgotten as well.
7. I mean, there is no point bragging that you are faster than the Hulk.
8. Not because Superman and Capt. Marvel are "stronger" because outside of their silver age versions, there is no showings of either of them being physically superior to Hulk.
9. Much more than likely it would be superman in this case, not since he is smarter but since Batman would examine hulk, make a gamma-reducer (like Ultron did), and use it around the Hulk.
10. Much more than likely it would be superman in this situation, not simply because he's smarter but because Batman would review hulk, make a gamma-reducer (like Ultron did), and use it around the Hulk.
11. Its a little hard to say.Juggernaut has a constant level of strength while Hulks increases.Juggs however is alot smarter than Hulk(with the execption of WWH).
12. WASHINGTON - Superman is faster than a speeding bullet, the Hulk has his superhuman strength when he gets fired up, Spiderman can race though crowded city streets on his webs.
13. Also, superman is pretty quick, faster than hulk.
14. Also, superman is quite quickly, faster than hulk.
15. Even Superman Retreads was better than Hulk.
16. And that is why the Hulk is worse than Superman.
17. Superman is more 100 times better than the hulk.
18. I liked Superman better than Hulk but Hulk is underrated and is nowhere as bad as people say.
19. It was a great sequence, and a lot better than anything I saw in Lettier's later Incredible Hulk.
20. Leinil Francis Yu is the artist of Secret Invasion, Superman Birthright, Superior and Indestructible Hulk, among many others.

Summary:
When comparing the strength of Hulk and Superman, several arguments come into play. While Hulk has the potential to reach limitless strength [1], Superman would not allow him to get to that level [1]. However, it should be noted that in the comics, Superman is not physically superior to Hulk [2]. Hulk may have difficulty in articulating himself, with Superman being generally more eloquent [3]. Regarding the quality of films, the argument states that "Hulk" (Ang Lee's version) was better than "Superman" (Donner's version) [4]. In terms of intelligence, while Hulk is not as smart as Bruce Banner, Superman is smarter than the Hulk [5]. Comparing the two films, "Superman Returns" is considered worse than the discarded Hulk film [6]. In terms of speed, Superman is faster than Hulk [7][13]. Ultimately, the decision of which character is better comes down to personal preference.

Arguments Used: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 13

Summary:
When comparing the strength of Hulk and Superman, it is important to consider several factors. While Hulk has the potential for limitless strength [1], Superman is unlikely to let him reach that level [1]. In terms of physical superiority, Superman outside of PC versions is not physically superior to Hulk [2]. However, Superman is smarter than the Hulk [5] and is also faster [13]. It is worth noting that there are mixed opinions on the quality of films featuring these characters, with some arguing that "Hulk" directed by Ang Lee was better than "Superman" directed by Donner [4], while others claim the opposite [16]. Taking all these points into account, it is clear that Superman is the better option.

Relevant Arguments Used:
1, 2, 5, 13, 4, 16

Summary:
Superman and Hulk are often compared in terms of strength. While Hulk can potentially reach limitless strength, Superman would never let him get to that level if he is going all out [1]. In terms of physical superiority, any Superman outside of the PC (Post-Crisis) version is not considered stronger than Hulk [2]. Hulk may not speak eloquently, but Superman is not known for his communication skills [3]. The quality of films featuring the characters is subjective, but some argue that Ang Lee's "Hulk" is better than Donner's "Superman" [4]. Additionally, Hulk is not as intelligent as his alter ego, Bruce Banner, but Superman still possesses more intelligence than Hulk [5]. As for speed, it is redundant to compare Superman's speed with the Hulk's [7]. There are no definitive showings of Superman or Captain Marvel being physically superior to Hulk [8]. The argument that Batman would be able to analyze and create a gamma-reducer to neutralize Hulk's strength favors Superman in this situation [9, 10]. Juggernaut may have a constant level of strength and be more intelligent than the Hulk, but this is not the main point of comparison [11]. It is important to note that Superman is faster than Hulk [12, 13]. The subjective preference of Superman's films over Hulk's is not relevant to the comparison of strength [15]. Superman is often regarded as significantly better than Hulk, but the extent of this comparison is not further elaborated [16, 17]. Finally, it is stated that Hulk is underrated and not as bad as commonly believed [18]. The involvement of Leinil Francis Yu, known for his artwork in "Superman Birthright" and "Indestructible Hulk," does not contribute to the comparison of strength [20].

Arguments used: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 15, 16, 17, 18

The needed structure is: summary (100 words), bullet-point list of the most topical avenues of comparison (200 words or more), the best option (3 words only). Please avoid artificial balancing of arguments.

2. This would put it near the performance of Erlang-significantly better than Python, Perl, and Ruby, but similarly significantly slower than C#, Java and native C++ .

4. Although the performance of Python is worse than Java, Erlang, Haskell, and ML, it's still better than Ruby.
5. of magnitude slower than Systems languages like Java.
6. Roughly, Java is better for so-called algorithm refinement than С++, and Ruby or Python are better then Java.
7. Ruby executes a whole lot slower than Java.
8. This also makes Java faster than Ruby.
9. Ruby can be 20x slower than Java in fact.
10. Yes Java is quite a bit faster than Ruby.
11. Okay, I have heard it all: Ruby On Rails (RoR) is so much cooler and simpler than Java EE.
12. There are lots and lots of testimonials about working with Ruby being easier and faster than working in Java - .
13. One thing I'd point out is that Ruby as a language has much better support for files and text... meaning XML parsing is much, much nicer in Ruby than in Java.
14. It has to be able to solve real problems in a much better and easier way than Java does now.
15. I also agree that C#'s evolution is smoother and faster than that of Java, which is a language that I'm not fond of.
16. So at the end of the day, writing Ruby Cocoa apps is going to be a whole lot better and easier than writing Java Cocoa apps .
17. So at the end of the day, writing Ruby Cocoa apps is going to be a whole lot better and easier than writing Java Cocoa apps.

completions:
Summary: When comparing Java and Ruby in terms of learning Object Oriented Design, it is important to consider their performance, development speed, and language features. Java is known for its quick execution and algorithm refinement [6], making it suitable for complex applications. However, Ruby, with its Ruby on Rails framework, allows for faster app design and rollout [1]. Ruby also has better support for file and text manipulation, including XML parsing [13]. While Java may be faster in performance compared to Ruby [3], Ruby offers a simpler language and faster development process [11]. Overall, considering the focus on Object Oriented Design, the better option is Ruby.

Relevant arguments used: 1, 6, 13, 11, 3

Summary:
In terms of object-oriented design, Java and Ruby have their own strengths and weaknesses. While Java may be quicker in execution, Ruby on Rails (RoR) offers faster app design and roll-out [1]. Java is faster than Python and Ruby but slower than C#, Java, and native C++ [2]. Ruby executes slower than Java [7], and can be up to 20 times slower than Java [9]. Ruby has better support for files and text, making tasks like XML parsing easier [13]. While Ruby may be simpler and faster than Java [19], it may take some time for Ruby to be on par with Java in terms of capabilities [18]. 

Comparison:
- Execution speed: Java is generally quicker in execution [1]. Ruby executes slower than Java [7], and can be significantly slower [9].
- App design and roll-out: Ruby, particularly with Ruby on Rails, offers faster app design and roll-out [1].
- Support for files and text: Ruby has better support for handling files and text, making tasks like XML parsing easier [13].
- Object-oriented design: Both Java and Ruby support object-oriented design, but their approaches and capabilities differ. Java is known for its strong support for object-oriented programming principles, while Ruby offers a more flexible and dynamic approach.
- Simplicity: Ruby is considered simpler than Java [11], making it easier and faster to work with [12].
- Future development: While Ruby may have advantages over Java in certain areas, it may take some time for Ruby to achieve the same level of capabilities as Java [18].

Best Option: Ruby [19]

Summary:
Java is known for its faster execution and algorithm refinement, making it ideal for complex algorithmic tasks. On the other hand, Ruby offers faster application design and rollout with its Rails framework. Ruby also has better support for files and text, making tasks like XML parsing easier. However, Java outperforms Ruby in terms of overall performance. While Ruby is simpler and faster in some aspects, it still lags behind Java. [13, 14, 18, 19]

Relevant Arguments:
- Java can be quicker than RoR in execution, but app design and rollout are faster with Ruby on Rails. [1]
- Ruby executes slower than Java. [7]
- Ruby can be 20x slower than Java. [9]
- Ruby as a language has much better support for files and text, making tasks like XML parsing easier. [13]
- Java is known for its faster performance overall. [3, 5, 8]
- Ruby is simpler than Java and faster in certain aspects, but it still lags behind Java. [18, 19]

Best option: Java

completions:
Summary:
Family Guy and The Simpsons are both popular animated sitcoms but have different styles and appeal to different audiences. While some argue that Family Guy is better, others believe The Simpsons holds the superior position. Ultimately, the choice between the two comes down to personal preference as each show has its own strengths and weaknesses.

Topical avenues of comparison:
1. Humor: Family Guy is known for its edgier, more irreverent humor, often relying on shock value and pop culture references. The Simpsons, on the other hand, focuses on satire, clever wordplay, and wholesome humor that appeals to a wider audience.
2. Characters: Family Guy features a dysfunctional, often politically incorrect family, with characters like Peter Griffin and Stewie becoming fan favorites. The Simpsons has a larger ensemble cast with iconic characters such as Homer, Marge, Bart, and Lisa.
3. Cultural impact: The Simpsons has been on the air for over three decades and is often praised for its social commentary and cultural references, making it a significant influence in popular culture. Family Guy, while popular, has a more niche following and cultural impact.
4. Writing: The Simpsons is often hailed for its well-crafted, smart storytelling and character development. Family Guy's writing, while humorous, can sometimes be criticized for relying too heavily on shock value and non-sequitur jokes.
5. Longevity: The Simpsons has a proven track record of maintaining its quality over a long period, whereas some argue that Family Guy has declined in quality over time.
6. Overall appeal: The Simpsons has a broader appeal due to its more family-friendly nature, allowing a wider audience to enjoy the show. Family Guy, with its edgier humor, may attract a more specific demographic.

The best option: Personal preference.

Summary:
Family Guy and The Simpsons are both popular animated sitcoms with their own distinctive styles and fan bases. While opinions on which show is better vary, there are several avenues of comparison that can be explored. The more topical avenues of comparison include the current state of the shows, personal preferences, writing quality, influence of other cartoons, and the ongoing success of each series. After considering these arguments, the better option overall is "The Simpsons."

Avenues of Comparison:
1. Current State of the Shows: Some argue that Family Guy has surpassed The Simpsons in recent years [1], while others believe the opposite [13].
2. Personal Preferences: Many individuals express a personal liking for one show over the other [3, 5, 6, 7, 11, 12, 16, 18].
3. Writing Quality: It is acknowledged that Family Guy may not have better writing than The Simpsons [8], while some argue that the writing on other cartoons, such as Futurama, is not as good [4].
4. Influence of Other Cartoons: Family Guy and American Dad are mentioned as shows that have been better than The Simpsons for years [9]. On the other hand, South Park and The Simpsons are highlighted as fresher and easier to watch [19].
5. Ongoing Success: The Simpsons is recognized for having had a successful run this season [20], and there are predictions that a potential Family Guy movie might be better than The Simpsons movie [10].

Best Option: The Simpsons.

Summary:
"The Simpsons" and "Family Guy" have been the subject of comparison for many years. While some argue that "Family Guy" is better, others believe "The Simpsons" is superior. Upon analyzing the arguments, it is clear that the most topical avenues of comparison include the current quality of each show, personal preference, the writing, the success of spin-offs, and the overall condition of the shows. After considering these points, the best option emerges as "The Simpsons."

Relevant Arguments:
1. Family Guy is way way better than the Simpsons nowadays.
2. Family guy is way better than the Simpsons.
7. Family Guy is better than the Simpsons EVER was in my opinion.
13. Family Guy is in way worse condition than the Simpsons.
15. I always felt The Simpsons was far better than Family Guy.
20. Honestly, The Simpsons have had a better run this season than Family Guy.

The Best Option: 
"The Simpsons"

Summary:
Java and Smalltalk are both object-oriented programming languages, but they have some significant differences. While Smalltalk has advantages in terms of its superior grammar, easier refactoring, faster initial development, and more user-friendly development environment, Java is simpler, more suitable for team settings, and has better frameworks. Smalltalk may have been faster in the past, but Java has gained popularity due to aggressive marketing and its ability to perform functional tests faster. Ultimately, considering the arguments presented, the better option is Java.

Comparison Points:
1. Java is simpler than C++ and Smalltalk, making it easier to learn and understand [1].
2. Smalltalk's VMs may not be as advanced as those of other languages like Java or C# [2].
3. Java is more suitable for team settings and has a better platform [3].
4. Smalltalk has a more superior grammar compared to Java's C-like grammar [4].
5. Smalltalk is not necessarily harder to learn than Java [5].
6. Java has better frameworks, particularly for web development [6].
7. Smalltalk encourages developers to think more about APIs compared to Java [7].
8. Java's marketing efforts have contributed to its popularity, even though Smalltalk is considered superior by some [8].
9. Java performs functional tests faster than Smalltalk [9].
10. Java is considered a better high-level language than Smalltalk [10].
11. Evidence suggests that Java is inferior to Smalltalk [11].
12. Commercial Smalltalk is faster than Java in most aspects [12].
13. Smalltalk has a more user-friendly development environment compared to Java [13].
14. Smalltalk browsers are easier to learn and use than major Java IDEs [14].
15. Refactoring in Java is harder compared to Smalltalk [15].
16. Prototyping is easier in Smalltalk compared to Java [16].
17. There are other languages, such as Lisp, Scheme, Python, Ruby, which are considered better than Java and Smalltalk [17].
18. While Prolog and Smalltalk are superior to Java in many ways, Java remains more mainstream [18].
19. Smalltalk has a superior method syntax, while Java offers other features Smalltalk lacks [19].
20. Initially, Smalltalk was faster than Java, but Java has caught up in performance [20].

Relevant Arguments Used: 1, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 18, 19, 20

Best Option: Java

Java and Smalltalk can both be considered powerful object-oriented languages, but there are notable differences between them. In terms of learning Object Oriented Design, several key points can be compared:

1. Complexity: Java is simpler than both C++ and Smalltalk [1]. This simplicity can make it easier for beginners to grasp the concepts of Object Oriented Design.

2. Team Setting: Java as a language and platform is well-suited for team development [3]. It provides a clear structure and conventions that facilitate collaboration and maintainability.

3. Grammar: Smalltalk's grammar is often considered superior to Java's C-like grammar [4]. This can make the syntax of Smalltalk more intuitive and expressive.

4. Learning Curve: Contrary to popular belief, Smalltalk is not necessarily harder to learn than Java [5]. Smalltalk's consistent and concise nature can contribute to its accessibility for beginners.

Based on these points of comparison, the better option for learning Object Oriented Design is Smalltalk. Its superior grammar and ease of learning make it an attractive choice for those looking to delve into Object Oriented Design. 

Arguments used: 1, 3, 4, 5

Summary:
In comparing Java and Smalltalk, several arguments have been put forth. Java is considered simpler than C++ and Smalltalk [1], and its platform is perceived to be superior to that of Smalltalk [3]. On the other hand, proponents of Smalltalk praise its superior grammar [4] and argue that it is not harder to learn than Java [5]. Java is also considered better for frameworks [6], while Smalltalk encourages developers to think harder about APIs [7]. Smalltalk is renowned for its faster performance [12] and superior development environment [13, 14]. However, Java offers several features that Smalltalk lacks [19]. Ultimately, the decision of which language is better for learning Object Oriented Design rests on the following arguments: simplicity [1], platform superiority [3], grammar [4], ease of learning [5], suitability for frameworks [6], emphasis on API thinking [7], performance [12], development environment [13, 14], and feature offerings [19].

Argument Numbers Used:
1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 12, 13, 14, 19

Best Option: Java
